http://leuphana.de/resource/university/l.name: Leuphana University of Lüneburg
http://leuphana.de/resource/university/l.description: Leuphana University of Lüneburg is a public university in Lüneburg, Lower Saxony, Germany.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Educational Sciences (IBIWI)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: At IBIWI, the prerequisites, processes and effects of education & upbringing, especially in the general education school system, are researched and taught.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of English Studies (IES)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IES contributes with English language courses to linguistics, literature and cultural studies as well as to foreign language didactics in various degree programmes.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Ethics and Theological Research (IET)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: Research and projects at the Institute for Ethics and Theology (IET) cover a wide range of topics: ethics, religious education, systematic and historical theology as well as the interpretation of the Bible and other 'holy' texts. Current research focuses on the trans-religious conversation between Judaism, Islam and Christianity, as well as the question of a plural European religious ethos in the face of the dwindling interpretive power of secularisation theory (Pippa Norris). The question is: W

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute for Exercise, Sport and Health (IBSG)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IBSG is dedicated to sports science topics such as school and extracurricular children and youth sports as well as health and training science.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Fine Arts, Music and Education (IKMV)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: At the IKMV, teacher training as well as modules and content for cultural studies and in-service programmes are offered.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of German Language and Literature Studies (IDD)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IDD trains students in teacher training for the subject German at primary schools, secondary schools, intermediate schools and vocational schools.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Mathematics and its Didactics (IMD)
Institute of Psychology in Education (IPE)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IFP consists of seven departments in which various aspects of psychology are researched and taught with an emphasis on transfer and application in practice.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Social Work and Social Pedagogy (IFSP)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IFSP trains students for the teaching profession at vocational schools and conducts research in the areas of child welfare, diversity, migration, social work education and social inequality.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Social Science Education (ISWB)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The ISWB deals with economic and political education within the framework of a social science-oriented concept.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Culture and Aesthetics of Digital Media (ICAM)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: At ICAM, research and teaching is done on how digital media techniques affect research and culturalisation processes and how these have transformed.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of History and Literary Cultures (IGL)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IGL is dedicated to cultural studies-oriented research in history and literature.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Urban and Cultural Area Research (IFSK)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IFSK belongs to the Faculty of Cultural Studies and is divided into the departments of Building Culture, Cultural Geography and Tourism Studies.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Philosophy and Art History (IPK)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: At the IPK, the long traditions of philosophical and art-scientific thought are examined and related to current issues.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Sociology and Cultural Organization (ISCO)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: At ISCO, questions of cultural theory and organisation and related interdisciplinary discourses are researched and taught from sociological perspectives.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute for Auditing & Tax (IAT)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IAT bundles and expands Leuphana University's central competencies in the areas of "auditing, taxes, law and economics".

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of New Venture Management (IGM)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description:
The IFA is divided into the departments of Banking and Finance, Financing and Financial Economics, and Accounting and Taxation. 
The IFA offers courses in the College and in the Graduate School, namely in the Major Business Administration, the Master's programme Management and Entrepreneurship and the Minor Business Economics.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Information Systems (IIS)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: At the Institute of Information Systems, we work on topics related to digital transformation, data-driven innovation and machine learning.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Experimental Industrial Psychology - LüneLab
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The LueneLab conducts research on business psychology issues in the areas of safety, stress and market research as well as traffic psychology.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Knowledge and Information Management (IWI)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: At IWI (formerly ICS) we primarily model and design useful computer software.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute for Management and Organisation (IMO)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: Organizations play a key role in our society. People create organizations to implement their plans and attain their goals. Organizations provide the structure that allows people to work towards common goals in a collaborative manner. Such collaborative efforts take place in for-profit or non-profit as well as in governmental or non-governmental organizations.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Management, Accounting & Finance (IMAF)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IMAF deals with sustainable corporate governance and monitoring as well as reporting, financing and taxation.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Marketing (IFM)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IFM aims to find scientifically sound and practically relevant answers to strategically important questions in marketing.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute for Production Technology and Systems (IPTS)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IPTS deals with materials, manufacturing, measurement and control technology as well as supply chain and production management.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/ce.name: Centre for Sustainability Management (CSM)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/ce.description: The CSM focuses on corporate sustainability management, CSR and social entrepreneurship and offers Bachelor, Master and MBA programmes.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Ecology (IE)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: Research foci at IE are the effects of global changes on organisms, biotic communities and biodiversity loss.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Ethics and Transdisciplinary Sustainability Research (IETSR)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IETSR is dedicated to the societal transformation towards sustainability and the inclusion of diverse stakeholders in research processes.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Sustainability Psychology (ISP)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: AT ISP the "Psychology and Sustainability" working group conducts research based on central psychological theories and methods and develops these further in a practice-oriented manner, especially in the area of climate and sustainability. This includes how sustainability thinking and action develops over the lifespan, also in institutional and informal learning processes, how risks are understood and communicated by different individuals, how sustainable health promotion can be implemented, and

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Sustainable Chemistry (INSC)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: At the INSC, issues related to chemical substances and products are addressed in research and teaching from a sustainability perspective.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Sustainability Governance (INSUGO)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The members of the Institute of Sustainability Governance (INSUGO) focus their work on a fundamental question: Which public institutions and regulation systems are necessary to achieve the normative goal of sustainability in a complex and pluralistic society? The answer to this question is provided by a broad scientific approach which is based on research, academic teaching and knowledge transfer with practitioners on topics of public sustainability governance.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/so.name: Social-Ecological Systems Institute (SESI)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/so.description: The Social-Ecological Systems Institute is devoted to studying the complex dynamics between people and their environment.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/su.name: Sustainability Education and Transdisciplinary Research Institute (SETRI)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/su.description: At SETRI, the Sustainability Education and Transdisciplinary Research Institute, we embrace sustainability as a positive vision for a world that is both safe and just. We investigate how these concepts need to be applied within our local contexts to become tangible. We believe that in order to achieve this vision, we require spaces where we can collectively unlearn unsustainability in processes and mechanisms of inner and outer transformations.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Political Science (IPW)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IPW handles research, teaching and studies in the subject of political science and is closely linked to the Center for the Study of Democracy (ZDEMO).

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/le.name: Leuphana Law School (LLS)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/le.description: Das Institut für Wirtschaftsrecht ist in der Fakultät Wirtschaftswissenschaften angesiedelt. Der interdisziplinäre Ansatz bestimmt Forschung und Lehre des Instituts. Ausgehend von praxisrelevanten Fragestellungen werden systematisch juristische und betriebswirtschaftliche Sicht miteinander verknüpft. Fachliche Schwerpunkte bestehen in den Bereichen Internationales Vertragsrecht, Steuerrecht und Revision, Arbeitsrecht und Personalmanagement, Umweltrecht sowie Financial Services.

http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.name: Institute of Economics (IVWL)
http://leuphana.de/resource/institute/in.description: The IVWL has a thematic focus on labour economics, empirical economic research, economic policy, economic theory and financial markets.

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name:
ZDEMO - Zentrum für
Demokratieforschung
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: Das Zentrum für Demokratieforschung (ZDEMO) beschäftigt sich mit der Analyse demokratischer Strukturen und Prozesse in Politik, Gesellschaft, Wirtschaft und Umwelt. Kernthema der Forschung sind Fragen von Legitimität und Leistungsfähigkeit von Demokratien. Das Zentrum erforscht diese unter drei wesentlichen Gesichtspunkten: Wertewandel und Human Empowerment, Parteienregierung und institutioneller Wandel sowie Beteiligung und öffentliche Politik. Zudem engagiert sich das Zentrum aktiv in der wiss

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name: Methodenzentrum
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: Das Methodenzentrum ist eine zentrale Einrichtung der Leuphana Universität Lüneburg. Ziel des Methodenzentrums ist die Bereitstellung und systematische Förderung einer qualitativ hochwertigen Methodenausbildung für Studierende aller Studiengänge auf Bachelor-, Master- und PhD-Niveau. Außerdem unterstützt das Methodenzentrum Forschende aller Disziplinen der Leuphana Universität, insbesondere Nachwuchswissenschaftler, Doktoranden, Projektmitarbeiter und Studierende in der Anwendung und Entwicklung

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name: Zukunftszentrum Lehrkräftebildung (ZZL)
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: Das Zukunftszentrum Lehrerbildung ist eine Einrichtung der Leuphana Universität zur systematischen Weiterentwicklung der Lehrerbildung in Lüneburg. Die Leuphana arbeitet stetig an einer weiteren Verbesserung der Ausbildung zukünftiger Lehrkräfte. Eine forschungsbasierte Bildung von Lehrerinnen und Lehrern steht im Mittelpunkt aller Bemühungen um die Qualifizierung der nachfolgenden Generationen und um die Sicherung des wissenschaftlichen Nachwuchses. Hierbei nimmt das Zukunftszentrum eine innovi

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name: Centre for Digital Cultures
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: Im Centre Digital Cultures arbeiten Medien-, Kultur- und Sozialwissenschaftler gemeinsam mit Juristen, Informatikern, Aktivisten, Künstlern, Produzenten, Formatentwicklern und Designern, um digitale Kultur zu verstehen und zu prägen.

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name: Forschungszentrum Digitale Transformation
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: Das Forschungszentrum Digitale Transformation der Fakultät Management und Technologie widmet sich den Herausforderungen der Digitalisierung in Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft. Forscherinnen und Forscher aus den Disziplinen Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Ingenieurwissenschaften, Volkswirtschaftslehre, Wirtschaftsinformatik und Wirtschaftspsychologie kooperieren in interdisziplinären Projekten mit regionalen, nationalen und internationalen Partnern mit dem Anspruch, durch Forschung zu einem Wissensprozess

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name: Institute for Sustainable Development and Learning
Yunus Centre for Social Business and Values
Zentrum für Theorie und Geschichte der Moderne
Zentrum für empirische Forschung zu Sprache und Bildung (ERLE)
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: Das Forschungszentrum ERLE (Empirical Research on Language and Education) bietet als Ort innovativer Forschung ein Umfeld für den interdisziplinären Austausch zu „Language and Education“ zwischen verschiedenen Disziplinen.

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name: Leuphana Center for Organization & Social Transformation (LOST)
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: The Leuphana Center for Organization & Social Transformation (LOST) is a dynamic research community dedicated to the study of organizational phenomena and their impact on social change. The members of the research center share a special interest in the organization of entrepreneurship, sustainability and digital transformation. We theorize and empirically study the intricacies of organizational phenomena, seeking to understand their fluid and evolving nature, and their impact on social transform

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name: Leuphana Institute for Advanced Studies (LIAS) in Culture and Society
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: LIAS: Leuphana Institute for Advanced Studies in Culture and Society ist eine zentrale Forschungseinrichtung der Leuphana Universität Lüneburg

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name: Center for Critical Studies (CCS)
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: Das Center for Critical Studies versammelt die für kritische Theorien, Analysen und Praktiken einschlägige Forschung der Lüneburger Kulturwissenschaften.

http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.name: Leuphana Center for European and International Law
http://leuphana.de/resource/research-cen.description: Die Mitglieder des Leuphana Center for European and International Law (CEIL) forschen zu grundlegenden Themen des Europa- und Völkerrechts.
